source.7745861d:
## Target Distribution - Survived

From the pie chart, there seems to be more passengers that did not survive!
source.06600c58:
## Number of Parents/ Children Proportions

Majority of the pasengers have parents or children aboard the doomed ship!
source.08e20972:
## Age distribution

Distribution of age appears slightly right-skewed, yet almost symmetrical. Most of the passengers are from the 20-30 age range.
source.eebec80e:
## Passenger Class Proportions

From the pie chart below, majority of the passengers come from the 3rd class. The 1st and 2nd class have similar proportions with 1st class being slightly more.

source.e4df695e:
# Missing Data

Another important step before we proceed to process the data will be to check for any missing entries. If there are, we try to make sense of it (e.g. possible clauses) and how we can fix it.
source.44d1847a:
# Introduction

In this notebook series, I'll be sharing my typical approach to machine learning (ML) problems (in this case competitions), in an end-to-end ML pipeline starting with the data analyses, to feature engineering, validation strategies, model training and finally inference (with post-processing techniques).

My notebooks in this series can be found in the links below:
- [Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)](https://www.kaggle.com/khoongweihao/part-1-exploratory-data-analysis-eda)
- [Preprocessing & Feature Engineering](https://www.kaggle.com/khoongweihao/part-2-preprocessing-feature-engineering)
- [Model Training & Validation Strategies](https://www.kaggle.com/khoongweihao/part-3-model-training-validation-strategies)
- [Inference & Post-processing Techniques](https://www.kaggle.com/khoongweihao/part-4-inference-and-post-processing-techniques)

Bonus notebooks include adoption of recent research in terms of models, hyperparameter search, etc. They can be found in the links below:
- Hyperparameter optimization with Optuna
- TabNet
source.7ebb0670: The training set contains the features used to train the models later on, and contains the ground truth labels (`Survived`).
source.ca475375: The test set does not contain the sample ground truths and is used to perform predictions for submission to the competition.

Majority of the passenger fares are under 50, which is in-line to the chart which showed majority of passengers being in the 3rd class.
source.f68033eb: Looks like we will have to perform some data imputation or further analysis as to whether entries with missing data can be dropped!

source.6195c96a: This is a sample submission file which is a set of predictions that assume all and only female passengers survive, as an example of what a submission file should look like.
